New Records: Spencer Strider won his 17th game, a major league-leading 17th win
Austin Riley became the third Braves player to reach 35 homers, joining Matt Olson (51) and Acuña (37)
Key Match Events: The Braves clinched their sixth straight NL East title, beating the Phillies 4-1
Austin Riley hit a two-run homer in the first inning
Kevin Pillar added an RBI double in the fourth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Braves were looking to clinch their sixth straight NL East title
The Phillies were trying to stay in contention for the NL wild card
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Brian Snitker said 'We’ve checked one box'
Reliever Kirby Yates said 'So far, it’s the best part about being a baseball player'
Strider said 'Let’s get ready for October'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves clinched in 146 games, their second-quickest clinch in the divisional era
The Braves have seemingly made winning the East a rite of September since the 1990s
The Phillies lead the NL wild card and the teams could face each other in October
